body: Your description of the bridge over the moonlit landscape is breathtaking. I can almost hear the whispers of the night in the stillness. It's like a perfect moment frozen in time.
I can really feel the quiet and the stillness of your description. It’s like time is suspended, and all you can do is experience the moment. Such a poetic thought.

The misty mornings you’re painting sound incredible. I’ve always admired artists who can capture that ethereal quality in fog. Have you experimented with watercolor to create that soft, blurred effect?
